title: 'The ball's in our court': Archer says heroic win may have swung Ashes England's way – video
text:
Jofra Archer believes the England cricket team have "planted a few seeds of doubt" in the minds of Australia's players with their incredible win at Headingley.

Asked on Wednesday if the momentum is now with England going into the fourth Test, paceman Archer said: "We don't have to be optimists. I think so."

England's attack looks likely to be bolstered by the return of record wicket-taker Jimmy Anderson following injury.

Archer, who has already claimed 13 wickets in the series, said Anderson is "a world-class bowler and it only takes a little bit of Jimmy magic to end an innings."
description: Archer says heroic third Test win may have swung Ashes in England's favour
